data.title: Lazy encryption
data.statement:
You have to decode a secret message. 

The message consists of characters from the alphabet [[al]]
`al = 'ABCDEFGHIJKLMNOPQRSTUVWXYZ '`
(the last character of [[al]] is a space!)

The original message has been encoded by using a shifted version of the alphabet [[al]]. "Shifting" in this context simply means moving every character to the right or left by an unknown offset. Every character that would be out of bounds at the right side of the alphabet, is inserted again at the beginning and vice versa.

Example: 
```"ABCDEFGHIJKLMNOPQRSTUVWXYZ " -- shift by 2 to the right -->
"Z ABCDEFGHIJKLMNOPQRSTUVWXY"```

By replacing every character in the plaintext message with the character at the same index in the shifted alphabet, the message becomes unreadable. 

Example:
<<Message>>: "HELLO WORLD"
`al   = 'ABCDEFGHIJKLMNOPQRSTUVWXYZ '`
`s_al = 'YZ ABCDEFGHIJKLMNOPQRSTUVWX' // shifted by 3 to the right`
`--> orig_msg = 'HELLO WORLD'`
`--> encr_msg = 'EBIILXTLOIA'`

The first character of the encrypted message has already been decoded. Use that information to derive the shifted alphabet and decode the rest!

Goal

You have to decode a secret message.

The message consists of characters from the alphabet al
al = 'ABCDEFGHIJKLMNOPQRSTUVWXYZ '

(the last character of al is a space!)

The original message has been encoded by using a shifted version of the alphabet al. "Shifting" in this context simply means moving every character to the right or left by an unknown offset. Every character that would be out of bounds at the right side of the alphabet, is inserted again at the beginning and vice versa.

Example: 
"ABCDEFGHIJKLMNOPQRSTUVWXYZ " -- shift by 2 to the right -->
"Z ABCDEFGHIJKLMNOPQRSTUVWXY"


By replacing every character in the plaintext message with the character at the same index in the shifted alphabet, the message becomes unreadable. 

Example:
Message: "HELLO WORLD"
al   = 'ABCDEFGHIJKLMNOPQRSTUVWXYZ '

s_al = 'YZ ABCDEFGHIJKLMNOPQRSTUVWX' // shifted by 3 to the right

--> orig_msg = 'HELLO WORLD'

--> encr_msg = 'EBIILXTLOIA'


The first character of the encrypted message has already been decoded. Use that information to derive the shifted alphabet and decode the rest!




   

      
Input

      
Line 1: The hidden message m
Line 2: The decoded first character of m

   

   

      
Output

      
The decoded message

   

   

      
Constraints

      
The unshifted alphabet always looks like this:  
"ABCDEFGHIJKLMNOPQRSTUVWXYZ "
  
(with a space at the end!)  
m contains only characters from al

   

   

      
Example

      

         

            
Input

            
EBIILXTLOIA
H

         

         

            
Output

            
HELLO WORLD
